explanations.unsupervised learning: The paper uses latent class analysis (LCA), which is an unsupervised learning technique to identify patterns in life events without predefined labels.
explanations.classification: The study classifies adolescents into different latent classes based on their life events, which is a form of classification.
explanations.clustering: Latent class analysis (LCA) is a clustering method used to group participants into distinct classes based on their responses to the Life Events Questionnaire.
